## Description {#details}

The options string of a duration type has the grammar:

duration&#95;options ::= &#91;unit&#93;&#91;show&#95;unit &#91;number&#95;options&#93;&#93; unit ::= <code>h</code>|<code>m</code>|<code>s</code>|<code>ms|</code>us<code>|</code>ns<code> / show&#95;unit ::= </code>+<code> | </code>-&#96; number&#95;options ::= options string for a integral or floating point type

<Link id="details" />



<Link id="details" />



| &quot;&quot; | 1s | 1 s | | &quot;ms&quot; | 1s | 1000 ms | | &quot;ms-&quot; | 1s | 1000 | | &quot;ms-n&quot; | 1s | 1,000 | 



<Link id="details" />



If the unit of the duration type is not one of the units specified above, it is still possible to format it, provided you explicitly request a display unit or you request that the unit is not displayed.

Definition at line 139 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/chrono-h">Chrono.h</a>.
